data.title: Lunch
data.text: Best Cuban sandwich I've ever had. I got mine with the puebla cochinita (I'm sure I spelled that wrong but it's pork and the first choice on the list of proteins).

data.title: wonderful food and good live music
data.text: I went to see a locale band from Lawton play and we decided to eat there too. The food was wonderful - it's not like regular Mexican food - its fresh and the service is great and quick.

data.title: Taste of real Mexico
data.text:
A great experience of authentic Mexican food.  Not that there's anything wrong with Tex-Mex.  I love me some Tex-Mex...  but this is different.  Really thoughtful flavors and execution of flavors from central and coastal Mexico.

The tequila bar is dope. So many different tequilas and mescal.  Just ask the bartender for recommendations based on your tastes.  Best hand made margaritas in Oklahoma  real lime, real tequila.

Would be 5 stars... but front of house is sometimes sketchy... not always someone at the register when you walk in.

Great live music place, although sometimes the music inside is too loud.  Would be better on the patio.

data.title: Good tacos
data.text: The tacos here are very good. Many meat options to choose from. Although, I also stayed a bit later into the evening and they had DJ performances which I didn't quite understand. Are they a restaurant or a night club? I really don't think the two go together. I can only imagine the non sense that ensues after the kitchen closes. Keep it a restaurant, please!

data.title: Really good
data.text: There are three things I judge Mexican restaurants on, salsa, guacamole, and margarita's. All three were very good. I would definitely recommend this place.

data.title: Armando is brilliant
data.text: New menu items added every month include many hispanic favorites, healthy options for the gluten-challenged and low calorie options.  The Sangria is spectacular -- made from real fruit - no mixes and beautiful- to- watch preparationat the well-stocked bar.

data.title: Puebla tacosy tequileria
data.text: this review is on the great tequila selection here. I have become somewhat of a tequila guy in the last ten years and this restaurant has an outstanding selection.  I just counted the selection you can try and the total is 80! I love the location and Armondo the owner is very friendly. I love the location in the old part of downtown which is also a huge plus, the place reminds me a little bit of sante Fe new mexico, If you like tequila like i do come down and visit this great place!

data.title: Good but still could use a little work.
data.text: I had the pork Cohicheeto I think it was.  I think I just butchered the spelling but anyway, it was pretty good.  I thought the pickled onions were a good thought but they seemed bitter to me, the meat itself was excellent.  My taco came with a Habanero relish which had a nice heat kick to it but it also had a sweet tang and that same weird bitterness.  My husband had the grilled chicken taco which he said was good, I didn't get a bite.  :)  The queso and chips   had a really good flavor but was very thin and soupy.  All of the tacos were of reasonable price so I was happy with that.  Hope this place makes it as it has loads of potential.

data.title: Great selection of street style tacos!
data.text: Delicious tacos, huge variety of meats and spice levels, great salsas and the best selection of mexican beers around! Not fancy but loads of atmosphere! Even outside dining options in front or back!

data.title: Great place, great food!
data.text: The food is amazing! We tried their carne asade and pork tacos- so good! The atmosphere is clean and fun. The prices were awesome! We'll be coming back!

data.title: Great, fast lunch or dinner!
data.text: First time dining here, but not the last. We had the tacos; smoked chicken, tilapia, smoked pork and a beef one (don't remember the name). I didn't really like the smoked chicken taco, but I should have ordered the grilled one. Next time! Chips and salsa were extra, but very good. Our food was delivered faster than anywhere I've been in ages! Tip- order your drink from the bar before your food, or it will arrive before you can even get up to the bar to order. Super fast! Margaritas were delicious, but tiny and a bit over priced.

data.title: Very good burrito and tasty sauces
data.text: First time visit to this new restaurant. The burrito was large and tasty, Chips and salsa were extra. They do have a nice variety of salsa to choose from and all were very good. There hottest had a bite but nothing to be afraid of. The wall menu had a good selection of mexican themed foods. They have what appears to be a full bar. The prices seemed a little high but the food was very good. The smoked beef in my burrito had a great flavor not found elsewhere in Norman. I feel like this place can make it in Norman's finicky food scene it will be a nice addition to my lunch options. I think they are hoping to attract the after work crowd; with the likes of The Garage nearby it will be difficult.

data.title: Unimposing facade, impressive tastes.
data.text: This is quickly becoming less of a secret in Norman, as word of mouth passes about how good the street tacos are. I had the Puebla Cochinita Pibil, and it was very good, but everyone in our party of four likewise enjoyed their selections. The streets tacos are bigger than you might be used to at other restaurants, so you might want to constrain yourself to just two on the first visit.
